page.title: 10St. Michael and All Angels
page.content: Rev. Grahame Smith and his family have lived in the modern rectory next to the church since 1976.He holds a service in most of his 5 churches in this area each Sunday. Uffington has no choir and the average congregation numbers twenty.Sunday school is held weekly and the bell ringers practice twice a week. There are about three each of weddings, christenings and funerals each year. As the church-yard is almost full,cremations are often held at Marholm. Tombstones must be made of stone,small with no curbstones for easier churchyard maintenance. Church repairs are often done freely by local craftsmen helped by Man Power Services. Various fund-raising activities take place. In 1984 a new heating system was installed costing Â£6000 and a Christian Stewardship Campaign took place to covenant funds.
